intro: Costus aureus, commonly known as golden costus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers, and is characterized by its aromatic, strap-like leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters at the top of its stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Costus aureus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance.
